item.title: Configuring a Local Network on Debian and Ubuntu
item.description:
Introduction link

Not always easy to remember what to put in these damn files, right? Here are some simple examples.

Configuring Network Interfaces link

Edit the file /etc/network/interfaces.

Static IP Addressing link

For example, here’s how I configure my eth0 interface:

 auto lo eth0
iface lo inet loopback

# Interface eth0
iface eth0 inet static
 address 192.168.0.1
 netmask 255.255.255.0
 broadcast 192.168.0.255
 network 192.168.0.0
 gateway 192.168.0.138
